author: Staff Reporter
text:
: The Government has issued a notification constituting the Traders Welfare Board as announced in the budget .

The Chief Secretary will head the Board, which will have the Secretary to Government (Finance/Commercial Taxes) as member.

The Board will be represented by Commissioner, Commercial Taxes Department, Director, Local Administration Department, Joint Secretary/Deputy Secretary (Finance) and Commissioners of Puducherry and Oulgaret Municipalities.

The Board will also have representatives of traders associations, not exceeding one from each association or trading community, representing the four regions of the UT to be nominated by the Government. The objective of the Board is to provide members welfare measures such as group insurance scheme, financial assistance for marriage, group medical insurance to the members and their family members, cash reward to the wards of members and any other welfare measures that may be entrusted to the Board by the Government, the notification said. Rs.300 will be collected from each member at the time of enrolment.
title: Traders welfare board constituted
